title: Fluids - Claim_fluid mass in a pipe

content.description: Water moves through a horizontal section of pipe with different cross-sectional diameters at points <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi> </math> and <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> as shown in the figure.
content.question: Which of the following claims about the volume of water moving through the pipe is correct?

choices.label: A greater volume of water passes Section <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> each second when compared to Section <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>.

A greater volume of water passes <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> each second when compared to Section <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math>

An equal volume of water passes Section <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and section <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> each second.
The volume of water that passes each section depends on the direction the fluid is flowing.

content.answer: An equal volume of water passes Section <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> and section <math alttext="Q" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Q</mi></math> each second.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
